data.title: Step into the past
data.text: This was a great place to see a movie. It makes the whole experience of watching a film into an event. The whole experience is beautiful.

data.title: One of Tampa's most interesting sights
data.text: You haven't really seen Tampa until you've visited the quirky Tampa Theater. Make sure you get a tour or watch a movie there. The organ and player come up from deep below the stage to entertain the audience. The theater feels like you are sitting outside underneath a star lit sky. The movies are always interesting and varied. It's the place to see artsy films, independent films and even fun sing-a-long films. Just go...it's something to experience.

data.title: Fun historic place to watch a movie
data.text: Such a beautiful theater and great place to catch a movie. Gorgeous historic interior and comfortable seats. Loved sitting in the balcony and overlooking the whole theater.

data.title: Tampa Theater - Historical Beauty
data.text:
This historical theater is absolutely breathtaking. It is romantic and magical. The Holidays bring movies that will remind Boomers of their childhood and introduce classics to the millennials. 

Check out the schedule on their website.

data.title: A One of a kind cultural treasure
data.text: This historic theater is a feast for the eyes and viscerally transports you to another time. The theater shows an eclectic mix of independent,  foriegn films and even film classics. They have live performances of comedians,  music groups and community events, and the ghost tours are a must when visiting downtown Tampa.  A true cultural treasure!

data.title: Movie theater from the past
data.text: This is a totally marvelous place to see a movie. Relaxing, calming- go into the past when seeing a movie was a real event!  Do not go here without a tour by one of the docents to discover the theater's past. History lovers- it's a must!  Don't miss it!

data.title: A must see
data.text: This beautiful building holds a true gem of Tampa. The 1920s building is a must for anyone who romances over the old fashion cinema concept, making a simple trip for a movie into a true night out. Make sure to get there early and enjoy the organist before the performance and keep an eye out for special events.

data.title: Stunning
data.text: This theater is absolutely beautiful from start to finish.  I was awed by the architectural detail both inside and out.  The staff were wonderful despite a fairly raucous crowd.

data.title: One of the most beautiful theaters in the world.
data.text: Over the years, from 2005-present, I have been to concerts/performances in the theater, to see limited release movies, classic movies, and traditional films at the Tampa Theatre.   Truly it stands alone in a world full of corporate modern theaters.   I will continue to return every year, whenever I can.

data.title: 90 years of Gothic surroundings
data.text: We went to the Tampa Theater "Nightmare on Franklin Street" for  the "Halloween Ghost Tour".  The gothic opulence of 90 years never bores me.  As soon as I heard The Mighty Wurlitzer Organ's first notes, I knew to look into "the pit" where it "mysteriously" rises with heart pounding sounds! It transported me back to 1964 when I first was there to see my first James Bond movie.  The "stars" twinkling in the "sky" and the "moving clouds" still amazed me!   A MUST SEE for tourists and even for us locals.   It is a gorgeous wondrous theater that is now a non-profit.  Well worth going for the tour or stay and watch a movie!  Popcorn is great, the old world elegance still captivates any one who sets foot inside the theater.  Who knows, you may even encounter a ghostly spirit!

data.title: 1920's Movie Experience
data.text:
The elegance of the 1920's.... the inside of this theatre is magical.  You will find yourself staring at all the architectual detail.  Get there early to watch the pipe organ rise up from under the stage to enjoy a pre-movie recital.  The movie house shows a lot of classic movies.  Watching a movie there sends you back in time, right down to the concession stand in the lobby.

Negatives: these are 1920 style wooden seats.  Not comfortable for a two hour event and no room for legs.  Concession stand is small and typically very long line to purchase snacks.

I've been to this theatre many times.  I will go again in a heart beat.  It just takes you back in time....especially with a good black & white movie!

data.title: Actually been to several concerts there before this year
data.text:
Before renovation Goverment Mule and Emmylou Harris 
After Emmylou Harris 
A beautiful art deco theatre with friendly staff and concession lines that are short
My only complaint is the acoustics which seemed loud and made the sound sort if muddled . I was sitting in front row of balcony so not sure if it was better in orchestra but they could use more acoustic friendly walls

data.title: Show
data.text: Tampa theater is a historic place to visit.The main entrance, main hall, stairwell to second floor and elevators are beautiful and well preserved.It is right in the heart of down town Tampa close to other touristic places. You can visit the only 18th century cigar factury .If you love cigars, that is the place to buy them

data.title: What a wonderful life
data.text: Went here to watch a wonderful life with the family. It is such an awesome theater. The history just speaks through the walls. The sky in the actual theater has a night sky and stars that look real. This place is truly a classic. (Beware: the seats are the original seats so they aren't that comfortable)

data.title: Must see
data.text: This theater is Historic and a must visit and my first visit to these rare theaters from a past age was in San Antonio TX back in 89 which is a major stop for air force in basic training on our one day furlough so this is a must see especially with children as we should not forget the art of the past

data.title: amazing architectural framing for your evening
data.text: Tampa Theater transports you to the Roaring Twenties. If you love Cinema and architecture, this is the place to be

data.title: Beautiful old movie palace
data.text: Great place to visit and see recent movies along with old film revivals .  Huge skyline interior and lobby.

data.title: Love Tampa Theater!
data.text: I have been going to the Tampa Theater since I was a little girl!  I used to see first run movies there!  The most beautiful theater I have ever seen!  So full of antiquary!  A must visit for everyone!

data.title: beautiful must see!!
data.text: such beautiful ornate wood inside this theatre, I was so impressed, loved it.  Has nice events and movies here

data.title: Love the Wurlitzer!
data.text: I came here three years ago to see the silent film Wings and to hear 106 year old organist Rosa Rio on the Wurlitzer theater organ. She has since passed on but the organ remains and is worth a visit.
